page.title: 05Houses in Sheering.
page.content: There are two parts of{Sheering-Upper Sheering,which is the older settlement and{Lower}Sheering.Lower Sheering was built because of the railway.More people began to travel to work in London,so houses were built near the station. There are four pubs.Three are in Upper Sheering,because many people travel through there on the way to Chelmsford. Over the last fifty years many people have moved into Sheering;therefore most houses are modern.The modern houses are brick built with tiled roofs.The older houses in the main street are mostly 17th Century and built from plaster and wood with tiled roofs.The Victorian houses are terraced or semi-detached and built from either red brick or plaster.Some have slate roofs.
